The plant has a simple structure with a thallus that lacks true roots, stems, and leaves, instead having a leaf-like structure called a phyllodium. Empleurum species are often found in humid climates and are known for their ability to thrive in nutrient-poor soils. These plants play a role in soil stabilization and provide habitat for various microorganisms.
